Title:
Taxonomic studies of some often over-looked
Hypocreomycetidae
Keywords:
Bertiaceae · Ceratostomataceae · Chaetosphaerellaceae ·
Coronophoraceae · Nitschkiaceae · Scortechiniaceae · Niessliaceae
Abstract:
The number of species in Sordariomycetes has increased
greatly, however, some genera that had been discovered earlier are
poorly known and documented and thus need to be redescribed. This paper
is a continuation of the work on ‘Taxonomic studies of some often
over-looked Diaporthomycetidae and Sordariomycetidae’. We provide
descriptions, notes and figures or drawings for 71 genera belonging to
seven families in Hypocreomycetidae based on type materials, authentic
specimens or literature. The taxonomic placement of the genera are
re-defined based on morphology and/or phylogenetic analysis based on a
modern taxonomy. Two new genera, Neocryptosphaerella and
Pseudocryptosphaerella are described. Seven new combinations proposed
are Fracchiaea myricoides, Neocryptosphaerella celata, N. globosa,
Pseudocryptosphaerella elliptica, P. castaricensis, P. cylindriformis
and P. malindensis.
